body:
**Thread ID silently ignored**

`resolveCronDeliveryPlan()` only reads `threadId` from `job.delivery` (`deliveryThreadId`), but the “legacy” path (where `job.delivery` is absent and delivery behavior is inferred from `payload.deliver/channel/to`) never considers any thread id. If an existing client/job relies on payload-only delivery configuration, setting a thread identifier won’t have any effect and delivery will remain unthreaded. If you intend thread support to work in the legacy/payload path too, it needs to be plumbed from `job.payload` (and included in the returned plan) the same way `channel`/`to` are.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: src/cron/delivery.ts
Line: 53:56

Comment:
**Thread ID silently ignored**

`resolveCronDeliveryPlan()` only reads `threadId` from `job.delivery` (`deliveryThreadId`), but the “legacy” path (where `job.delivery` is absent and delivery behavior is inferred from `payload.deliver/channel/to`) never considers any thread id. If an existing client/job relies on payload-only delivery configuration, setting a thread identifier won’t have any effect and delivery will remain unthreaded. If you intend thread support to work in the legacy/payload path too, it needs to be plumbed from `job.payload` (and included in the returned plan) the same way `channel`/`to` are.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>
